isis.stitle: TSI 04-12-01R - Correct Fuel System Priming Procedure To Prevent Injector Tip Failures

subjectgroup.subject: Correct Fuel System Priming Procedure To Prevent Injector Tip Failures

geninfo.para: Because "dry starts" cause injector tip failures, a procedure that primes the fuel system before starting the engine must be followed. When the fuel injection system is dry after engine service, cranking the engine to start without first priming the fuel system will result in an overload condition in the injector tips. This overload occurs because there is no fuel present to cushion the needle valve as it lifts and seats. To avoid this condition, follow the procedure below after performing any maintenance, including fuel filter replacement that may allow air to enter the fuel system.

warning.para: Always place transmission in neutral, apply parking brake, and chock the wheels prior to engaging the engine starter. Failure to do so could result in unexpected vehicle movement and cause property damage, personal injury, or death.

caution.para: Do not start the engine without priming the fuel system.

step1.para: Disconnect the injector harness at the valve cover.
Use the hand primer to fill the fuel system. NOTE: Pump until hand primer is hard to depress.
Crank the engine three times for 15 seconds each. Re-apply the hand primer after each crank cycle.
Once the hand primer remains hard to depress after the 15 second crank, reconnect the injector harness and start the engine.
Clear fault codes 513 (low side to bank 1 open) and 514 (low side to bank 2 open) that was logged by cranking the engine with the injector harness disconnected.
